oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Choir to give classical, Easter program, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about a musical program: “McKendree Methodist Church will be the scene Sunday evening at 7 o’clock of a musical program presented by the church choir. Besides Easter hymns, the choir composed of thiry-two members, shown above, will sing Mendelssohn’s Oratorio Elijah. Soloists will be Claude Sharpe, Miss Emma Cornelia Pitt, Miss Margaret Ackerman, Orion Ramsey, H. B. Barnett, and accompanist will be J. Richard Thomasson, organist. Reading from left to right: Miss Helen Cage, Miss Mary Jakes, Miss Mary Alice Hackney, Miss Myrtle Canada, Mr. Thomasson, Miss Helen Hayes, Billie Vliet, Miss Mary F. Goman?, Miss Marie Smith. Second row: Miss Mattie B. Woods, Miss Agnes Brown, Miss Josephine Oliphant, Miss Lillie Rudisell, Miss Constance Choate, Miss Thelma Corbitt, Miss Jewell Thomas, Caryl Lewis. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
